column4: hey... i know it isn't the right place to ask, but i couldn't get much help anywhere... i'm using eclipse+pydev, and my program works fine from the editor, but when i try to run it from terminal, i get a lot of error. I've tried to reproduce the command that is called by pydev, but i doesn't work. can someone help e please?

the problem is that i can convert qstring to pystring like str(qstring), and it runs fine from eclipse, but it doesn't from terminal, to get this part working on terminal, i have to do str(qstring.toUtf8()).
but this isn't the only problem. when i fix one another appears, and so on.
sounds like you haven't printed out the program and gone over it with highlighter to see how it works.
what do you mean with "printed out the program"? thanks
the fact is, a printout hardcopy of a program helps alot in debugging the logical structure that may be broken by fixing on programming error in it
how long is your pyqt4 program in # of lines?
you just need to print out the lines of the function where the error is.
have you discovered the logical error in your script?
sorry the delay. my program has 2k lines, i don't understand... if it runs fine from pydev, i think there should be no error. i just want to run it the same way outside pydev.
ok that's a big program.  have you used pylint on it?
at the resulting command-line, there's a configuration called "The PYTHONPATH that will be used" maybe i need to reproduce this setting on terminal?
ok. thank you. i'm gonna try to reproduce that setting.
